prefixDef.p: This prefix resolves references to the lexical data source.
This prefix resolves references to the Digital Repository Service.

choice.seg: while they were going around talking
whatever (this is that) you are doing
they said, they used to say

ab.seg: Now, seven[1] elders wanted to capture a little person
[2] These seven elders went to the water ceremony for seven nights until they found out what they wanted to know about capturing a little person
The elder men got ready[3] to go to the place where they would capture[4] this little person
They headed for a place that was very quiet
They all sat down to block the path to the place where they thought[5] the little person would arrive
Sure enough, a short while later, just before sunrise, they heard the little people talking, but couldn’t see them
Soon, it was daybreak, then one of the little people came near to where the men were sitting
When he came to them, this little person spoke
“What do you elders want, being here like this?”[6] asked the little man
“We are asking you to teach us what you know about sacred healing," they told him
The little people truly taught them
[7] Our ancestors say that is how the elders learned so much about healing medicine

d:noteBlock.note: this one, i.e., a little person
new root -acvvʔs- 'go, walk; go and return'
adverbial clause with deverbalizer suffix, cf. CRG 333f.
< 'what happened before' cf. CWL: ᏄᎵᏍᏔᏅ nulistanv 'antecedents'
cf. kị²la⁴ 'early in; not long ago' (DF1975: 144)
cf. -alistvvhlú- 'take a seat, sit down', here without MID -ali-, thus new root -hlú- 'sit down'
cf. ᎤᎷᎯᏍᏗ u²lụ³hị³sdi 'for him to arrive' (DF1975: 102); long form of infinitive used at end of sentence (cf. CRG 74)
cf. ᎤᎩᏨᏓ ᎢᏴᎢ u²gị²jv⁴da ị²yv⁴ʔi 'next morning', ᎤᎩᏥᏕᏱ u²gị²tsde⁴yi 'dawn' (DF1975: 164); ᎤᎩᏥᏍᎬ ugitsisgv 'dawn, daybreak' (AC1995: 61-62); NC ulsihnidena 'evening' (DHK1975: 216; 242)
WJ form reflects metathesis hle- > ehl- ; cf. hle²ki³ 'soon' (DF1975: 130), tlekíyŭ 'soon' (JM1887a:105)
converb suffix (CVB) used to indicate first in a succession of events, cf. CRG 337ff.
pronoun used for emphasis; cf CRG 151ff.
ms. has <Ꭲ> /i/, emended to <Ꮨ> /ti/ after ᏅᏬᏘ nv²wo³²ti 'medicine' (DF1975: 149), ᎠᏅᏬᏘ anvwodi 'cure' (AC1995: 60)
DAT used to refer to addressee; cf. CRG 403 (DAT = Applicative (APL)); note -th- for expected -t- normally triggered by 1/2PL -ijv- (-iicvv-) (h-alternation)
ᎾᏍᎩ ᎢᏳᏍᏗ naasgi iyusdi 'that's why, therefore' (CRG 316))
REL prefix emphasizing event took place in the past (cf. CRG 280)
< 'great ones' ᎤᏔᎾ u²³tạ²na 'big, large' pl. ᏧᎾᏔᎾ ju²³nạ²tạ²na (DF1975: 180)
